meanings.definition: A thin, waxy layer covering the outer surface of the cuticle of an insect or other arthropod.
meanings.sent1: The epicuticles of insects help protect them from dehydration.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the epicuticles of beetles to understand their unique properties.
meanings.sent3: The epicuticles of ants are like tiny raincoats, keeping them dry in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The epicuticles of spiders glisten in the sunlight, like delicate armor.
meanings.sent5: Touching the epicuticles of a caterpillar feels like touching a thin layer of wax.
